title: Top 10 Bulletproof Cars For 2025-26: Specs, Price, and Features
body: Bulletproof cars built with stronger frames and protective glass are designed to keep passengers safe without losing comfort or style. There are valid reasons for the differences in core specs, pricing, and notable features relevant to current market needs. Therefore, choosing the right car for safety can feel a bit overwhelming. Let’s explore the best 10 bulletproof cars for 2025-26 and see what makes these models innovative and impressive. The world’s most advanced and reputable bulletproof and armored vehicles bring together luxury design, strong performance, and military-grade protection. Let’s see what makes these high-end models stand out in the armored car market. The Suburban series was further refurbished in 2025 with the addition of the High Country, which makes the Chevrolet Suburban High Country a complete model. Its armored base price ranges from USD 250,000 to USD 420,000, which translates to BDT 3,05,86,450 - BDT 5,13,85,236 (USD 1 = BDT 122.35). The unarmored version starts at USD 83,400 (BDT 1,02,03,640). This full-size SUV runs on a strong 6.2-litre EcoTec3 V8 engine that makes 420 hp (horsepower), allowing the vehicle to move confidently even with the added weight of armor. When upgraded to Alpine Level A9 (CEN B6+), the Suburban is built to stop powerful weapons. It includes rifle rounds such as AR-15, 7.62x39, 7.62x51, and 5.56x45, along with blasts from two DM51 hand grenades. Read more: World's first flying car factory starts trial production in China A three-row layout supports up to seven passengers with premium comfort features, including heated and ventilated front seats and tri-zone climate control. Reinforced brakes and overlapping armored doors help keep the vehicle steady and mobile during dangerous situations. The Cadillac Escalade ESV Luxury enters the 2025 lineup with new upgrades that mix premium design with armored protection. Its base price falls between USD 280,000 and USD 380,000 (BDT 34,258,000 - BDT 46,493,000), while the unarmored model begins at USD 91,100 (BDT 11,146,085). This SUV carries a 6.2-litre V8 engine producing 420 hp. Inside, a large 55-inch curved digital screen and advanced driving technology add to its modern feel while still supporting solid handling on the road. The Alpine Level A9 armor includes hardened steel and multi-layer bullet-resistant glass that can withstand AR-15 and other high-caliber shots. A three-row interior fits seven passengers with heated leather seats, second-row climate control, and premium wood and leather finishes. Read more: Nissan tests driverless cars on busy Japan city streets Size, comfort, and protection come together when the GMC Yukon XL Denali appears in discussions about high-end armored SUVs. Armoring the vehicle charges from USD 280,000 to USD 350,000 (BDT 34,258,000 - BDT 42,822,500), while the sole car costs USD 80,495 (BDT 9,848,563). This 2025 Denali trim uses a 6.2-litre V8 engine that delivers solid power for a full-size luxury frame, saving room for up to 8 passengers with premium leather seating and modern technology. When upgraded to Alpine Level A9 (CEN B6+), the vehicle gains full 360-degree ballistic protection against strong rifle rounds, along with added floor shielding against hand grenade blasts. The armoring system includes certified ballistic steel around key structural areas, multi-layer bulletproof glass on all sides, and reinforced doors with heavy-duty hinges. Plus, there is also a run-flat tire technology supported by Hutchinson polycarbonate inserts to maintain movement even after damage. A legendary blend of durability and new-age design comes into focus when the Toyota 2026 Land Cruiser 300 enters the armored vehicle category. Its armored base price falls between USD 200,000 - USD 320,000 (BDT 24,470,000 - BDT 39,152,000), while the unarmored model begins at USD 63,275 (BDT 7,741,696). Read more: Iran loosens import restrictions on foreign cars and iPhones, trying to mask its economic woes This 2026 version features the i-Force Max 2.4-litre turbocharged inline 4-cylinder hybrid powertrain. It produces 326 combined horsepower and 465 lb-ft of torque, which gives the vehicle strong performance across many terrains. The CEN B6 armoring level offers certified protection against explosive threats and rifle fire while still keeping the Land Cruiser’s trusted off-road capability fully intact. Its protective build includes reinforced suspension designed for ballistic door overlaps that prevent shots from entering through seams, and thick steel plates around the cabin. It also has multi-layer ballistic glass, a strengthened fuel tank, and upgraded braking systems for reliable stopping power under pressure. Elegance and protection join forces when the Lexus LX 600 Luxury takes its place in the premium armored SUV category. Wrapping up the model with armor charges from USD 300,000 to USD 450,000 (BDT 36,705,000 - BDT 55,057,500). The pricing of the unarmored version starts from USD 116,950 or BDT 14,308,833. This 2025-refreshed model uses a 3.5-litre Twin Turbo V6 engine producing 409 hp, paired with a 10-speed sequential-shift transmission that delivers smooth and powerful movement. When upgraded to BR6 protection, the SUV shields the cabin, roof, and floor from strong ballistic fire and explosive blasts. Read more: 31 ousted MPs’ cars among 100 set to be auctioned INKAS door overlap systems create protective edges that stop bullets from slipping through door seams, while solid polycarbonate wheel inserts keep the vehicle driving even after tire punctures. Multi-layer ballistic glass keeps visibility clear and maintains the original Lexus design shape, making the added armor almost invisible. A blend of durability and long-standing reputation becomes evident once the Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 2026 enters the armored lineup. Its unarmored model starts at USD 195,500 or BDT 23,919,425, while the armored base price spans from USD 350,000 to USD 500,000 (BDT 42,822,500 - BDT 61,175,000). This 2026 version carries a 4.0-litre bi-turbo V8 engine delivering 577 hp, giving the compact SUV impressive power for both city roads and tough terrain. With B6–B7 protection, the vehicle keeps its well-known shape while offering top-tier defense against high-caliber gunfire. Reinforced steel and composite materials strengthen the cabin, doors, pillars, and floor without lowering performance. Multi-layer bullet-resistant glass protects every window while keeping visibility clear. An advanced suspension system supports smooth daily travel and strong off-road capability, making the armored G63 both secure and highly functional. A refined mix of luxury travel and tactical defense becomes visible once the Range Rover Autobiography LWB enters the armored category. The car carries a starting price of USD 179,500 (BDT 21,961,825), while wrapping it up with armors costs USD 380,000 - USD 580,000 (BDT 46,493,000 - BDT 70,963,000). Read more: 10 Best GPS Trackers for Cars in Bangladesh This 2025 Autobiography addition uses a 4.4-litre twin-turbo V8 engine with 523 hp, paired with an 8-speed automatic transmission that supports an armored weight of 7,860 pounds while still delivering capable performance. With Alpine Level A9 (B6+) certification, the SUV offers protection against AR-15 and armor-piercing rounds, along with resistance to DM51 grenade blasts. Lightweight certified steel and composite materials reinforce the cabin, roof, and floor, while multi-layer BR glass guards all windows from high-power rifle fire. Advanced terrain response systems and air suspension remain fully operational due to Alpine’s careful engineering approach. An elite standard of comfort and executive-level safety becomes clear when the Mercedes-Maybach S580 is introduced in the armored sedan class. Its armored base price is USD 480,000 - USD 770,000 (BDT 58,728,000 - BDT 94,209,500), and the unarmored model is priced at USD 207,150 or BDT 25,344,803. This 2025-built S580 comes with a 4.0-litre Biturbo V8 engine producing 496 hp and 516 lb-ft of torque, while the S680 variant offers even higher output. With Alpine Level A9 armoring, the sedan receives extensive upgrades. For instance, a four-band secure insert system, armored fuel tank and battery, reinforced braking parts, and customized rear-seat protection. Read more: Nagad to give BMW cars to all cricketers of Bangladesh team if they win World Cup 2023 Multi-layer ballistic glass shields every window from high-power rifle rounds and explosive threats. Despite the added armor weight, the 9G-Tronic transmission delivers smooth acceleration, allowing the armored S580 to move from 0 - 60 mph in about 5.2 seconds. A bold combination of hybrid power and armored engineering becomes evident once the BMW XM enters the premium protection segment. The armored configuration is offered within USD 350,000 - USD 500,000 (BDT 42,822,500 - BDT 61,175,000), while the unarmored factory model carries a price of USD 159,600 or BDT 19,527,060. This 2025-built XM uses a 4.4-litre twin-turbo V8 engine paired with an electric motor, producing 644 hp in the standard version and 738 hp in the Label variant. The coil-spring suspension, adaptive dampers, and active anti-roll bars work together to balance performance and stability, even when armor weight is added. Lightweight ballistic materials strengthen the XM without disrupting its performance abilities. Highway Assistant technology supports hands-free driving up to 85 mph, including eye-activated lane-change features for safer long-distance travel. Read more: Car Fire Safety: Common Causes and Immediate Things to Do A mix of rugged engineering and high-level protection becomes clear when the Defender OCTA Edition One is introduced in the armored SUV category. Its armored version is offered at USD 280,000 - USD 450,000 (BDT 34,258,000 - BDT 55,057,500), while the unarmored model is listed at USD 158,300 or BDT 19,368,005. This 2025-developed OCTA Edition One runs on a 4.4-litre twin-turbo V8 producing 626 hp and 553 lb-ft of torque, making it the most powerful Defender ever produced. With CEN 1063 BR6 certification, the vehicle resists 7.62mm rifle fire and withstands blasts from two DM51 hand grenades. INKAS provides full 360-degree ballistic coverage using military-grade armor around the cabin, roof, and floor. Multi-layer ballistic glass maintains clear visibility under threat. Meanwhile, reinforced hinges and overlapping armored door seams remove weak points and keep all entry paths secure. All 10 bulletproof cars represent the newest generation and top-tier protection with advanced technology for 2025-26. Chevrolet, Cadillac, GMC, Toyota, Lexus, Mercedes-Benz, Land Rover, Mercedes, and BMW lead the segment. The models are certified to resist threats from handguns to high-power rifles and explosives. Most commercial armored SUVs incorporate reinforced suspension systems, run-flat tires with polycarbonate inserts, multi-layer ballistic glass, and armored fuel and battery compartments.
